content.description: Climb up the large flake to the right of Better Than Mecca, protecting with a #4 cam if you wish.  From the little alcove at the top of the flake, pull out on hand jams to the steep thin crack.  Finish at a 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection: #4 cam to protect the flake (optional) and then a single rack of cams and nuts, mostly thinner stuff.
content.location: Directly to the right of Better than Mecca.

content.description: A mix of stemming and OW moves.  Gets shade in early afternoon.
content.location: First of three wide cracks immediately right of Sword of Damocles.

content.description: climb the crack on the right side of the perch to a small ledge where the infamous "sword" once stood, then up an off-hands crack. passable pockets and edges can be found hidden in the recesses of the crack.
A mix of layback and OW moves.  Harder at the top.
content.protection: You can place cams in the 3.5 - 5 camalot range (old sizes) down low, and will need larger gear for the upper half.
content.location: Second wide crack to the right of Sword of Damocles.

content.description: Start up thin cracks just right of a boulder. Then jog a little left and finish in the fist/OW crack. More challenging if you don't use the boulder
content.location: Left turn after coming down the concrete gully. Left of The Classic.

content.description: An easy start through a low angle off-width. Traverse across a flake to the upper crack, finish with painful hand jams to a two bolt anchor.
Follow the obvious flake up to a small bulge and then a dihedral.
content.location: Directly to the right of Wheeler Dealer.
Farthest east route in the Hotspot before turning the corner to the Main Wall.

content.description: Head up the nice cracks on the fairly clean face to a small bulge.  Crux is pulling through the overhang, though moves down low are not easy.
content.protection: A single rack of cams/nuts though double .5 - #1 cams would probably come in handy.
content.location: To the left of the large boulder near the base of Post Classic.  This is down the small hill to the climbers left of the Better than Mecca alcove.

content.description: Head up the bouldery moves on the left crack.  There is a easier low crux, and then some thin hand jams/lieback up to a steep ledge (looks like a huge ledge from below).  The second part of the climb heads up the obvious right facing corner with great, though steep and sharp, hand jamming/stemming.  Probably one of the better hand cracks on the sunny side of the canyon.
content.protection: Single rack, doubles of .75 and #1 camalots.
content.location: To the right of the large boulder, located down the small hill to the climbers left of the Better than Mecca alcove.
Rightmost of the four wide cracks in the Hot Spot.

content.description: Begin up the flake (left leaning layback) to a small "roof" with good handjams and protection.  Pull around bulge to easy climbing, followed by the crux pulling up a steep handcrack in a slightly right leaning shallow dihedral.  Jams and face holds to a good rest at a 2-bolt anchor.
content.protection: Single rack of cams and nuts to hand sizes.
content.location: Probably the most frequently done route in the middle section of the cliffs.  A gentle alcove with several decent climbs, BTM starts up the obvious flake on the right side of the alcove.  See the guidebooks for easier identification

content.description: Fun steep crack climbing! Hot spot is super warm zone , faces due southwest !
